{"step_by_step_thinking": "Centric relation is the position of the mandible in relation to the maxilla when the condyles are in their most superior position in the glenoid fossa. B. Wax cone method: This method involves placing a cone-shaped wax record between the maxillary and mandibular teeth and having the patient close into it. This method can accurately reproduce the centric relation position.
